Description
org.cojen.tupl

  • Uses of DatabaseConfig in org.cojen.tupl

    Methods in org.cojen.tupl that return DatabaseConfig
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.baseFile(File file)
    Set the base file name for the database, which must reside in an ordinary file directory.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.baseFilePath(String path)
    Set the base file name for the database, which must reside in an ordinary file directory.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.cachePriming(boolean priming)
    Enable automatic cache priming, which writes a priming set into a special file when the process is cleanly shutdown.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.cacheSize(long size)
    Convenience method which sets the minimum and maximum cache size, overriding the default.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.checkpointDelayThreshold(long delay, TimeUnit unit)
    Set the maximum delay before an automatic checkpoint is performed, regardless of the redo log size threshold.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.checkpointRate(long rate, TimeUnit unit)
    Set the rate at which checkpoints are automatically performed.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.checkpointSizeThreshold(long bytes)
    Set the minimum redo log size required for an automatic checkpoint to actually be performed.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.checksumPages(Supplier<Checksum> factory)
    Enable 32-bit checksums for all of the underlying database pages.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.cleanShutdown(boolean shutdown)
    When the process is cleanly shutdown, attempt to issue a full database shutdown.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.clone()
     
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.compressPages(int fullPageSize, long cacheSize, Supplier<PageCompressor> factory)
    Compress the underlying database pages, reducing overall size at the cost of performance.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.createFilePath(boolean mkdirs)
    Set true to create directories for the base and data file, if they don't already exist.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.customHandlers(Map<String,? extends CustomHandler> handlers)
    Provide handlers for recovering custom transactional operations.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.dataFile(File file)
    Set the data file for the database, which by default resides in the same directory as the base file.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.dataFiles(File... files)
    Stripe the database data file across several files, expected to be on separate devices.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.dataPageArray(PageArray array)
    Use a custom storage layer instead of the default data file.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.directPageAccess(boolean direct)
    Set true to allocate all pages off the Java heap, offering increased performance and reduced garbage collection activity.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.durabilityMode(DurabilityMode durabilityMode)
    Set the default transaction durability mode, which is SYNC if not overridden.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.enableJMX(boolean enable)
     
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.encrypt(Crypto crypto)
    Enable full encryption of the data files, transaction logs, snapshots, and cache priming sets.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.eventListener(EventListener listener)
    Set a listener which receives notifications of actions being performed by the database.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.eventListeners(EventListener... listeners)
    Set multiple listeners which receive notifications of actions being performed by the database.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.lockTimeout(long timeout, TimeUnit unit)
    Set the default lock acquisition timeout, which is 1 second if not overridden.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.lockUpgradeRule(LockUpgradeRule lockUpgradeRule)
    Set the default lock upgrade rule, which is STRICT if not overridden.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.mapDataFiles(boolean mapped)
    Enable memory mapping of the data files.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.maxCacheSize(long maxBytes)
    Set the maximum cache size, overriding the default.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.maxCheckpointThreads(int num)
    Specify the maximum number of threads for performing checkpointing, to speed it up.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.maxReplicaThreads(int num)
    If replication is enabled, specify the maximum number of threads to process incoming changes.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.minCacheSize(long minBytes)
    Set the minimum cache size, overriding the default.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.pageSize(int size)
    Set the page size, which is 4096 bytes by default.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.prepareHandlers(Map<String,? extends PrepareHandler> handlers)
    Provide handlers for recovering prepared transactions.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.readOnly(boolean readOnly)
    Open the database file in read only mode.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.replicate(ReplicatorConfig config)
    Enable replication using the given configuration.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.replicate(StreamReplicator repl)
    Enable replication with an explicit StreamReplicator instance.
    DatabaseConfig
    DatabaseConfig.syncWrites(boolean fileSync)
    Set true to ensure all writes to the main database file are immediately durable, although not checkpointed.
    Methods in org.cojen.tupl with parameters of type DatabaseConfig
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static Database
    Database.destroy(DatabaseConfig config)
    Delete the contents of an existing database, and replace it with an empty one.
    static Database
    Database.open(DatabaseConfig config)
    Open a database, creating it if necessary.
    static Database
    Database.rebuild(DatabaseConfig oldConfig, DatabaseConfig newConfig, int numThreads)
    Open an existing database and copy all the data into a new database, which can have a different configuration.
    static Database
    Database.restoreFromSnapshot(DatabaseConfig config, InputStream in)
    Restore from a snapshot, into the data files defined by the given configuration.
